page.title: 12Wansworth Prison
page.content: Wandsworth Prison was originally named Surrey County Jail and was constructed in 1863.The Reverend Harry Entwhistle, Anglican Prison Chaplin,visited The Study School to give us a short talk about H.M.Prison,Wandsworth.He started off by telling us about the sizes and shapes of the buildings.We discovered that the main building was set in the form of a cartwheel,and the spokes represented wings of cell blocks.The men prisoners were allowed half an hour visiting time per month.240 men were fitted into each cell branch,so altogether the prison held 1500 convicts.Their day started by getting up at 6.30 to prepare for porridge and hot water at 7.15 then onto one hour's exercise walking around a circular track,then hard tiring work inside a block for 2.50 pounds a week.In the evenings they are locked away.
